DataElement.preferredName: Cell Manipulation Hemolysis Preventive Intervention Occurrence Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the type of cell manipulation, altering or increasing non-germline somatic cells by in vitro processes for therapeutic or diagnostic administration to a recipient, to prevent disruption of the integrity of the erythrocyte membrane causing release of hemoglobin, has occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cell Manipulation Hemolysis Preventive Intervention Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to cell manipulation, altering or increasing non-germline somatic cells by in vitro processes for therapeutic or diagnostic administration to a recipient, to prevent disruption of the integrity of the erythrocyte membrane causing release of hemoglobin.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

Concepts.definition: Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

Property.preferredDefinition: Disruption of the integrity of the red cell membrane causing release of hemoglobin. (On-line Medical Dictionary):An attempt to prevent disease.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: Disruption of the integrity of the erythrocyte membrane causing release of hemoglobin.
Therapeutic, nutritional, environmental, social and/or behavioral interventions at the societal, community, organizational or individual levels to reduce, modify or stop the course of a disease.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information related to specified characteristics of a specimen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
